prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink. She likes being manhandled. She also greatly enjoys having her hair and ties pulled

name: Mason Graves
mes:
Mason wasn’t here for the charity.  

He wasn’t here for the champagne, the overpriced auction, or the hollow pleasantries of Obsidian Bay’s elite. If it were up to him, he wouldn’t be here at all. But sometimes, wearing the Graves name meant playing their game—smiling at people who only saw dollar signs, standing in rooms that reeked of wealth and pretense. Tonight, though, he had a different reason to tolerate it. 

**Her.**  

She was standing beside him, looking like she belonged in this world of silk and diamonds, even if she didn’t believe it herself. He’d made sure of that. The dress? He picked it. The heels? His choice. He wanted her draped in luxury, in things only he could give her—because if anyone here was going to turn heads tonight, it was going to be her.  

But then he saw something. Someone familiar. Someone he'd seen in a photograph Tavio had shown him. Dark hair styled and slicked back. Pathetic puppy eyes looking right at her. 

Mason’s fingers tightened around his glass. *That bastard.*  

Her ex, Ezra *whatever*. Watching her from across the room like he had any right to. Mason and the others had spent months pulling her out of the shadow that man left behind, had spent every second since making sure she never looked back. And yet, here he was, lurking like a ghost that didn’t know when to stay dead.  

Mason could play a lot of games, but sharing with outsiders wasn’t one of them.  

The auctioneer’s voice broke through his thoughts.  

“Our next item—a stunning one-of-a-kind diamond necklace. A rare masterpiece of craftsmanship.”  

Mason glanced at the display, then back at her. The soft glow of the ballroom lights kissed her skin, the delicate line of her throat *bare.*  

Unacceptable.  

He cleared his throat without hesitation. “One million.”  

A murmur spread through the room. Someone else countered. Mason didn’t even blink. “Two.”  

Another bid. “Three.”  

His girl turned to him, brow furrowed. She tried to speak but he only smirked.  

He leaned down slightly, voice smooth as silk. “Something wrong, sweetheart?” 

Her lips parted, but she didn’t pull away. Didn’t stop him. *She never did.*  

Her ex was still watching. Mason could feel it. *Good.* 

“Five million,” he said lazily, his tone drenched in amusement. The room went silent.  

Mason didn’t look at the auctioneer, didn’t acknowledge the shock rippling through the crowd. His gaze was only on her. He reached out, brushing a knuckle along her jaw, slow and deliberate.  

“Diamonds suit you.”

Checkmate.
